ID: C1VMIRH_00
From: Rana Krayem <Rana.Krayem@chalhoub.com>
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
CC: Samantha Booth <Samantha.Booth@chalhoub.com>; Tala Harmalani <Tala.Harmalani@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-07-23 14:45
Subject: FW: Baccarat - Loan agreement 
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Hagop 

 

Hope you are doing well!

We are in the process of landing Baccarat stock to an external company THG for an exhibition here in Dubai in November.

We are seeking your support on clause 5.2 on page 3 on the minimum value  of the WAC to claim insurance.

Products they are borrowing are Baccarat chandelier and Vase , relatively high value.

 

Regards 

Rana 

 

 

 

RANA KRAYEM	
SENIOR MANAGER ‚Äë BUYING	
C.G.R. FZE	
DUBAI	
‚Äë	
UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Subject: RE: Baccarat - Loan agreement 

 

Hi Tala

 

Hope you are doing well

Following up on the loan contract , do you have any updates?

The event will take place in November in Dubai and we need to make sure agreement is duly signed by both parties 

Sammy is still finalizing the list of products (including a chandelier)  they will borrow , that most likely need to be listed in the contract; yet at least let‚Äôs align with them on the main points.

 

Regards 

Rana

From: Rana Krayem 
Sent: Tuesday, 20 May 2025 5:17 PM
To: Tala Harmalani <Tala.Harmalani@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tala.Harmalani@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Samantha Booth <Samantha.Booth@chalhoub.com <mailto:Samantha.Booth@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: Baccarat - Loan agreement 

 

Hi Tala 

 

THG shared a template from their agreement in French.

We want our agreement to be drafted in English , and as chatted last time , we prefer following Tanagra template.

 

Let me know what you think and we will take it from there 

 

Regards 

Rana 

 

From: Rana Krayem 
Sent: Thursday, 8 May 2025 7:06 PM
To: Tala Harmalani <Tala.Harmalani@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tala.Harmalani@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Samantha Booth <Samantha.Booth@chalhoub.com <mailto:Samantha.Booth@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Baccarat - Loan agreement 

 

Hi Tala,

 

A French company under the name of THG will borrow few Baccarat pieces from us (including chandelier ) for a couple of days for an exhibition in November in Dubai Downtown.

Do you have any loan agreement in place that we can share with them? Or shall I request them to send us theirs?

 

Regards 

Rana

A French company under the name of THG will borrow few Baccarat pieces from us (including chandelier ) for a couple of days for an exhibition in November in Dubai Downtown.

Do you have any loan agreement in place that we can share with them? Or shall I request them to send us theirs?

 

Regards 

Rana 


--------------------------------------------------
ID: C1VMIRH_01
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Rana Krayem <Rana.Krayem@chalhoub.com>
CC: Samantha Booth <Samantha.Booth@chalhoub.com>; Tala Harmalani <Tala.Harmalani@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-08-12 12:14
Subject: RE: Baccarat - Loan agreement 
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Rana,

 

Hope all is well and sorry for the delay.

Reference to the below clause:
5. LIABILITY

1.	
	5.1 The Borrower shall be fully liable for loss or damage to the Products from receipt until their return.

1.	
	5.2 In case of damage, loss, breakage, or scratches:

1.	a) If the Weighted Average Cost (‚ÄúWAC‚Äù) is USD 400 or below, the Borrower shall reimburse the Lender the full WAC amount per item.

1.	
	b) If the WAC exceeds USD 400, the Borrower shall pay an insurance premium of USD 400 per damaged or lost item.

You can remove clause 5.2.

 

Clause 5.1 is already stating that the borrower is fully liable from receipt to return. The additional details of clause 5.2 don‚Äôt serve much purpose.

In all cases, the insurer will pay us and we will pay Baccarat so there is no need for the additional details provided in clause 5.2.

Trust the above clarifies.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Hagop
